result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwardine J. Garcia

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 2:00 PM/ RM 301, 22CM93 & 22CM39. Defendant Edwardine J. Garcia in court.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court via zoom for Edwardine J. Garcia.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Kerner has received a copy of the criminal complaint, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas in 22CM93. Atty Kerner requests traffic cases track along. State has scheduling concern. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:58 PM Defendant Edwardine J. Garcia in court.  Attorney Adam Kerner in court for Edwardine J. Garcia.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Atty Kerner has copy of complaint, waives reading, bond set, and enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 02:00 PM Defendant Edwardine J. Garcia in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Def. did contact P.D and is eligible.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain Absolute Sobriety.   No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.   No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

01:41 PM Defendant Edwardine J. Garcia in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edwardine J. Garcia appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like to check into counsel.  State gives bail bond recommendation & request $500 signature,   Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances  No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  Def. doesn't object.  Court orders $500 signature bond with conditions, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain Absolute Sobriety.   No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.   No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
